column4: hi. i've got a problem. just installed kubuntu on a laptop, and it does something strange with wireless - brings eth1 up, but without ip nor anything. i have to manually: sudo ifdown eth1; sudo ifup eth1 and then it works
do you have any ideas on what could i screw to make it that way?
all config is in /etc/network/interfaces as usual.
Please pastebin the contents of your /etc/network/interfaces
Hmm, that seems like it ought to work.  (Then again, my wireless fails to configure on boot, too.)
any idea on what to do to make it working automatically?
I have the same problem, my friend.  I wish I knew what the deal was.
Try looking through /var/log/syslog, /var/log/daemon.log and dmesg for output from dhclient during boot.  It may give you some hints.
do you start it by hand yourself?
Well, I "sort of" do it by hand.  I wrote a script that runs when I login.
I can help you get it to automatically configure your wireless when you *log in*, but not when you boot up
i can write a small script myself. this is not a problem.
Ahh.  Ok.  Yeah, it sucks.  I can't figure out how to get it to configure on bootup.
It used to work for me, but not anymore.  It's an awful hassle.
